Class SudoCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • SudoCell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class SudoCell
extends javax.swing.JLabel
    This class handles the creation and properties of an actual cell within the grid. This includes its candidate lists and value.
    Author:
    Thomas Keogh - thk11
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fillList()
      Fills the candidate list in the cell with the numbers 1-9, used in initial construction of each cell.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCandidates()
      Returns the candidate list for the cell in question, initial candidates just numbers 1-9.
      java.lang.String getValue()
      Method used for returning values contained within cells.
      void setCandidates(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> candidates)
      Takes a passed in list and sets it to be the candidate list for the cell, each cell stores its own candidate list which can then be retrieved and edited then saved back.
      void setValue(java.lang.String b)
      Set's the value of a cell using a passed in string.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue()
        Method used for returning values contained within cells. Used a lot when creating candidate lists based on row/column/grid values.
        Returns:
        The value contained within a cell

      • setValue

        public void setValue(java.lang.String b)
        Set's the value of a cell using a passed in string.
        Parameters:
        b - Sets a passed in string to be the value of a cell.

      • getCandidates

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCandidates()
        Returns the candidate list for the cell in question, initial candidates just numbers 1-9.
        Returns:
        The candidate list for the cell.

      • setCandidates

        public void setCandidates(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> candidates)
        Takes a passed in list and sets it to be the candidate list for the cell, each cell stores its own candidate list which can then be retrieved and edited then saved back.
        Parameters:
        candidates - The array list passed in that will become the new candidate list for the cell.

      • fillList

        public void fillList()
        Fills the candidate list in the cell with the numbers 1-9, used in initial construction of each cell.
